page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content:
In eight out of ten{Merton}homes{ some form of private transport is available.This is an important consideration,not only because of employment,but also because of the absence from the village of many basic amenities such as a Doctor's Surgery.
For those without transport buses pass through {Merton}daily en route to nearby towns.Local coach proprietors such as{Agrimotors}also provide regular trips to cities like Plymouth and Exeter.About 60% of the children at {The Clinton School}come by coach.
The local railway line between Torrington and Halwill Junction was closed to passengers in the late 60's. Not surprisingly only 20% of local people have travelled by train in the last year.
